Post-Match Reflections: Ben Stokes' 42* from 36 balls helped England secure a four-wicket win, showing typical poise under immense pressure.
Jos Buttler and Alex Hales posted 75 for the first wicket inside eight overs, giving England a strong start.
Sri Lanka's six wickets fell in the space of 65 deliveries, for the addition of just 54, after a promising start.
Dawid Malan's injury meant Ben Stokes batted at No. 3, highlighting his value to the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Adil Rashid finally registered a wicket, taking 1 for 16 from his four overs.
Mark Wood collected the more eye-catching figures of 3 for 26, contributing to Sri Lanka's 141 for 8.
England became the first team to win at the SCG when chasing.
England qualified for the semi-finals, knocking Australia out in the process.
